# Basic function extraction

file name=main.go
package main

func Hello() string {
	return "hello"
}

func goodbye() {
}
----

symbols file=main.go
----
function Hello public
function goodbye private

# Filter by visibility - public only

symbols file=main.go visibility=public
----
function Hello public

# Filter by visibility - private only

symbols file=main.go visibility=private
----
function goodbye private

# Methods with receiver

file name=types.go
package main

type Foo struct {
	Name string
}

func (f *Foo) Bar() string {
	return f.Name
}

func (f Foo) baz() int {
	return 42
}
----

symbols file=types.go
----
struct Foo public
method (Foo) Bar public
method (Foo) baz private

# Type declarations

file name=defs.go
package main

type PublicType int
type privateType string

type MyStruct struct {
	Field string
}

type MyInterface interface {
	Method() error
}
----

symbols file=defs.go
----
type PublicType public
type privateType private
struct MyStruct public
interface MyInterface public

# Constants and variables

file name=vars.go
package main

const MaxSize = 100
const minSize = 10

var GlobalVar string
var localVar int
----

symbols file=vars.go
----
const MaxSize public
const minSize private
var GlobalVar public
var localVar private

# Mixed file with all symbol types

file name=mixed.go
package main

import "fmt"

const Version = "1.0"

type Config struct {
	Port int
}

func (c *Config) Validate() error {
	return nil
}

func NewConfig() *Config {
	return &Config{Port: 8080}
}

var defaultConfig = NewConfig()
----

symbols file=mixed.go
----
const Version public
struct Config public
method (Config) Validate public
function NewConfig public
var defaultConfig private

# Empty file

file name=empty.go
package main
----

symbols file=empty.go
----
(no symbols)
